sub_elements.name: Persistent Identifier (DOI, RRID, or URI)
sub_elements.evidence: id: https://doi.org/10.13026/37yb-1t42 (line 7)
sub_elements.rationale: Dataset has persistent DOI identifier embedded in id field

sub_elements.name: Dataset Title and Description Completeness
sub_elements.evidence: title: Bridge2AI-Voice - An ethically-sourced, diverse voice dataset linked to health information (line 9); description: comprehensive 17-line description (lines 10-26)
sub_elements.rationale: Both title and extensive description present with comprehensive project context

sub_elements.name: Keywords or Tags for Searchability
sub_elements.evidence: keywords: 45 keyword entries covering voice biomarker, disorders, methods, standards (lines 29-72)
sub_elements.rationale: Extensive keyword list including technical terms, medical conditions, tools, and standards

sub_elements.name: Landing Page and Resources (page, hierarchical resources)
sub_elements.evidence: page: https://docs.b2ai-voice.org (line 27); external_resources: 11 resource entries (lines 708-765)
sub_elements.rationale: Primary landing page and comprehensive external resources section with 11 documented links

sub_elements.name: Hierarchical Structure (parent datasets, relationships)
sub_elements.evidence: External resources section implicitly documents hierarchical relationships through platform linkages (PhysioNet, Health Data Nexus, Zenodo)
sub_elements.rationale: While explicit parent_datasets and related_datasets fields are not present, hierarchical structure is documented through versioning (v1.0, v1.1, v2.0.0, v2.0.1) and multiple platform distribution points indicating dataset family relationships

sub_elements.name: Access Policy and IP Restrictions Defined
sub_elements.evidence: license_and_use_terms: comprehensive section with license terms list (lines 508-531)
sub_elements.rationale: Detailed license terms including registered access, data use agreement, authorized users, sharing restrictions, and compliance requirements

sub_elements.name: Regulatory Restrictions and Confidentiality Level Specified
sub_elements.evidence: Certificate of Confidentiality protections documented (lines 528, 696-705); HIPAA Safe Harbor de-identification (lines 418-430)
sub_elements.rationale: Regulatory framework clearly specified through Certificate of Confidentiality, HIPAA compliance, and IRB approval

sub_elements.name: Download URL or Platform Link Available
sub_elements.evidence: access_urls in distribution_formats: https://physionet.org/content/b2ai-voice/ (lines 541, 549, 557, 565)
sub_elements.rationale: Direct access URLs provided within each distribution format specification

sub_elements.name: Distribution Formats and File Types Specified
sub_elements.evidence: distribution_formats: 5 format entries covering Parquet (spectrograms, MFCCs), TSV (phenotype, static features), and raw audio (lines 533-573)
sub_elements.rationale: Comprehensive documentation of all distribution formats with technical specifications and access methods

sub_elements.name: Related Datasets and External Resources Linked
sub_elements.evidence: external_resources: 11 entries covering PhysioNet, GitHub, NIH RePORTER, Health Data Nexus, Zenodo, publications, DACO contact (lines 708-765)
sub_elements.rationale: Extensive external resources documentation linking to platforms, documentation, code repositories, and related publications

sub_elements.name: License Terms Allow Reuse
sub_elements.evidence: license_and_use_terms with explicit reuse provisions: public disclosure encouraged, recognition required, open-access publication preferred (lines 526-527)
sub_elements.rationale: License explicitly encourages research reuse and publication with appropriate attribution

sub_elements.name: Data Formats Are Standardized (encoding, format)
sub_elements.evidence: Standardized formats: Parquet for arrays (spectrograms, MFCCs), TSV for tabular data, JSON for dictionaries (lines 533-573)
sub_elements.rationale: Industry-standard formats compatible with Python datasets library and common data science tools

sub_elements.name: Schema or Ontology Conformance Stated
sub_elements.evidence: Schema conformance documented in header: Schema: src/data_sheets_schema/schema/data_sheets_schema_all.yaml (line 4); FAIR principles mentioned in keywords (line 70)
sub_elements.rationale: D4D schema conformance explicitly documented; FAIR principles referenced as guiding framework

sub_elements.name: Variable Metadata with Identifiers Defined
sub_elements.evidence: Data dictionaries provided: phenotype.json for demographics/questionnaires, static_features.json for acoustic features (lines 555, 563)
sub_elements.rationale: JSON data dictionaries provide variable-level metadata with column descriptions for all tabular data

sub_elements.name: Use Guidance Provided (intended, prohibited uses)
sub_elements.evidence: intended_uses: 5 use cases (lines 454-480); discouraged_uses: 4 discouraged use cases (lines 482-504)
sub_elements.rationale: Comprehensive use guidance covering both appropriate applications and discouraged/prohibited uses

sub_elements.name: IRB or Ethics Review Documented
sub_elements.evidence: human_subject_research: comprehensive section documenting USF IRB approval, informed consent, bioethics guidance (lines 641-658)
sub_elements.rationale: IRB approval explicitly documented with ethics review board identification and bioethics integration details

sub_elements.name: Deidentification Method Described
sub_elements.evidence: HIPAA Safe Harbor de-identification comprehensively documented with 18 identifier categories removed (lines 418-430)
sub_elements.rationale: Detailed deidentification methodology following HIPAA Safe Harbor standard with specific identifier categories enumerated

sub_elements.name: Privacy Protections Beyond Deidentification
sub_elements.evidence: Certificate of Confidentiality (lines 696-705); raw audio controlled access (lines 239-245, 664-671); free speech transcript removal (lines 399-405)
sub_elements.rationale: Multiple privacy protection layers including Certificate of Confidentiality, controlled access for sensitive data, and transcript removal

sub_elements.name: Informed Consent Obtained from Participants
sub_elements.evidence: Written informed consent documented for data collection initiative, data sharing, EHR access, and research data sharing (lines 645-648)
sub_elements.rationale: Comprehensive informed consent process documented covering multiple data collection and sharing aspects

sub_elements.name: Vulnerable Populations and Compensation Documented
sub_elements.evidence: Pediatric cohort with special ethical considerations documented (lines 296-301); additional privacy precautions for pediatric data noted (line 608)
sub_elements.rationale: Vulnerable population (pediatric) explicitly identified with documented ethical challenges and additional protection measures

sub_elements.name: Cohort or Subpopulations Characteristics Described
sub_elements.evidence: subpopulations: 5 cohorts detailed (Voice Disorders, Neurological, Mood/Psychiatric, Respiratory, Pediatric) with clinical characteristics (lines 270-301)
sub_elements.rationale: Comprehensive subpopulation documentation with clinical manifestations and disease-specific characteristics

sub_elements.name: Number of Instances or Samples Reported
sub_elements.evidence: instances: 306 participants, 12,523 recordings documented (lines 214-225)
sub_elements.rationale: Specific instance counts provided at both participant and recording levels

sub_elements.name: Variable-Level Metadata and Tabular Flag
sub_elements.evidence: JSON data dictionaries for phenotype and static features (lines 555, 563); tabular data explicitly documented as TSV format
sub_elements.rationale: Variable-level metadata provided through data dictionaries; tabular structure implicit in TSV format specification

sub_elements.name: Data Topics or Conditions Represented
sub_elements.evidence: Five disease cohort categories detailed in instances and subpopulations sections (lines 220-225, 270-301)
sub_elements.rationale: Data topics comprehensively documented through disease cohort categorization and clinical condition descriptions

sub_elements.name: Data Quality Issues and Anomalies Documented
sub_elements.evidence: sampling_strategies: detailed sampling methodology with non-random, non-representative sampling explicitly stated (lines 247-268)
sub_elements.rationale: Sampling strategy comprehensively documented including acknowledgment of non-representative sampling and potential limitations

sub_elements.name: Dataset Version Number Provided
sub_elements.evidence: Version progression documented: v1.0, v1.1, v2.0.0, v2.0.1 with dates (lines 603-615)
sub_elements.rationale: Multiple version numbers provided with release timeline from January through August 2025

sub_elements.name: Version Access Methods Documented
sub_elements.evidence: Version-specific documentation and DOI system mentioned (lines 606, 619); PhysioNet platform provides versioned access
sub_elements.rationale: Version access methods documented through PhysioNet platform and version-specific DOIs

sub_elements.name: Change Descriptions and Errata Provided
sub_elements.evidence: updates: detailed version history with specific changes (v1.1 added MFCCs, v2.0.0 expanded cohort, etc.) lines 599-619
sub_elements.rationale: Comprehensive update history documenting specific changes in each version release

sub_elements.name: Update Schedule or Frequency Indicated
sub_elements.evidence: frequency: Periodic versioned releases during data collection period (2022-2026) (line 609); future releases planned (lines 616-617)
sub_elements.rationale: Update schedule clearly specified with data collection timeline and planned future releases

sub_elements.name: Provenance and Source Derivation Documented
sub_elements.evidence: Generation provenance in header: Source: data/preprocessed/concatenated/VOICE_preprocessed.txt (89K, 9 source files) (line 3); preprocessing strategies document feature derivation (lines 345-415)
sub_elements.rationale: Source provenance documented in header; data derivation process comprehensively described in preprocessing section

sub_elements.name: Motivation or Purpose for Dataset Creation
sub_elements.evidence: purposes: 3 comprehensive purpose statements covering clinical integration, flagship dataset creation, and standards development (lines 76-93)
sub_elements.rationale: Detailed motivation documented across multiple dimensions of project goals

sub_elements.name: Primary Research Objectives or Tasks
sub_elements.evidence: tasks: 6 task entries covering AI/ML development for voice disorders, neurological, mood, respiratory, pediatric disorders, and workforce development (lines 95-128)
sub_elements.rationale: Comprehensive task documentation covering all clinical domains and educational objectives

sub_elements.name: Funding Sources and Mechanisms Listed
sub_elements.evidence: funders: 2 entries - NIH Office of the Director and NIBIB with detailed grant information (lines 195-210)
sub_elements.rationale: Primary and supporting funding sources documented with institutional details

sub_elements.name: Grant IDs or Award Numbers Present
sub_elements.evidence: Grant numbers: 3OT2OD032720-01S3 (NIH OD), R01EB030362 (NIBIB) with opportunity number OTA-21-008 (lines 199, 208)
sub_elements.rationale: Specific grant numbers and opportunity numbers provided for complete funding traceability

sub_elements.name: Creators and Acknowledgements Documented
sub_elements.evidence: creators: 13 entries including contact PI, co-PIs, co-investigators, and consortium (lines 154-193)
sub_elements.rationale: Comprehensive creator documentation with roles and institutional affiliations

sub_elements.name: Collection Mechanisms and Settings Described
sub_elements.evidence: collection_mechanisms: 3 detailed entries covering smartphone app protocol, multi-institutional collection, and comprehensive data collection protocol (lines 304-323)
sub_elements.rationale: Collection mechanisms thoroughly documented with device specifications, protocols, and standardization methods

sub_elements.name: Data Acquisition Methods Listed
sub_elements.evidence: acquisition_methods: 3 entries covering voice recordings, questionnaires, and EHR access (lines 325-342)
sub_elements.rationale: Comprehensive acquisition methods documentation covering all data modalities

sub_elements.name: Preprocessing, Cleaning, and Labeling Strategies
sub_elements.evidence: preprocessing_strategies: 7 entries with detailed technical specifications (lines 345-415); cleaning_strategies: 3 entries (lines 417-451)
sub_elements.rationale: Extensive documentation of preprocessing (audio conversion, feature extraction, transcription) and cleaning (de-identification, privacy protection) with technical parameters

sub_elements.name: Software and Tools Documented
sub_elements.evidence: Software tools documented throughout preprocessing: OpenSMILE, Praat, Parselmouth, Whisper, b2aiprep library, REDCap (lines 378-415)
sub_elements.rationale: Key software tools identified in preprocessing and cleaning sections with specific applications

sub_elements.name: External Standards and Resources Referenced
sub_elements.evidence: external_resources: 11 entries including standards publications, platforms, repositories (lines 708-765); FAIR principles in keywords (line 70)
sub_elements.rationale: External standards documented through resources section and FAIR/CARE principles references

sub_elements.name: Known Limitations Documented
sub_elements.evidence: Limitations implicitly documented: non-representative sampling (line 263), pediatric data not yet released (line 301), multi-session requirements for subset of participants (lines 308-310)
sub_elements.rationale: While not in a dedicated known_limitations field, substantive limitations are documented throughout the datasheet in sampling_strategies and instances sections

sub_elements.name: Systematic Biases Identified and Described
sub_elements.evidence: No explicit known_biases field present
sub_elements.rationale: Dataset acknowledges non-representative sampling but does not explicitly document systematic biases in a dedicated section

sub_elements.name: Data Anomalies and Quality Issues Noted
sub_elements.evidence: No explicit anomalies field present
sub_elements.rationale: Quality control measures described but specific data anomalies not explicitly documented

sub_elements.name: Sensitive Content and Warnings Provided
sub_elements.evidence: sensitive_elements: 4 comprehensive entries covering voice biometrics, EHR data, demographic data, and Certificate of Confidentiality (lines 660-705)
sub_elements.rationale: Extensive sensitive content documentation with specific sensitivity details for each category

sub_elements.name: Ethical Review Details Including Conflicts
sub_elements.evidence: human_subject_research includes IRB approval and ethics review board identification (lines 655-658); bioethics guidance integration documented (lines 649-653)
sub_elements.rationale: Ethical review comprehensively documented including review board, approval process, and bioethics framework

sub_elements.name: Dataset Published on a Recognized Platform
sub_elements.evidence: PhysioNet distribution documented throughout (lines 207-210, 533-573, 592-596, 710-713); Health Data Nexus alternative platform (lines 730-733)
sub_elements.rationale: Publication on recognized platforms (PhysioNet, Health Data Nexus) extensively documented though not in dedicated publisher field

sub_elements.name: Citation and DOI for Cross-referencing
sub_elements.evidence: DOI: https://doi.org/10.13026/37yb-1t42 (line 7); recognition of data source required in publications (line 527)
sub_elements.rationale: DOI present in id field with citation requirements specified in license terms

sub_elements.name: Community Standards or Schema Conformance
sub_elements.evidence: FAIR principles (line 70), CARE principles (line 71), D4D schema conformance (line 4), PhysioNet requirements (line 518)
sub_elements.rationale: Multiple community standards referenced including FAIR, CARE, D4D schema, and PhysioNet platform standards

sub_elements.name: Outreach Materials and Documentation Links
sub_elements.evidence: page: https://docs.b2ai-voice.org (line 27); external_resources: comprehensive documentation including GitHub, publications, NIH RePORTER (lines 708-765)
sub_elements.rationale: Extensive outreach and documentation resources covering project docs, code repositories, publications, and grant information

sub_elements.name: Related Datasets with Typed Relationships
sub_elements.evidence: No explicit related_datasets field with typed relationships present
sub_elements.rationale: Version relationships documented but not formal typed dataset relationships to other Bridge2AI or related datasets

strengths: Exceptional completeness across all discovery, access, and retrieval dimensions (100% for elements 1-2)
Outstanding ethical documentation including IRB approval, informed consent, deidentification, and privacy protections beyond standard requirements
Comprehensive technical transparency with detailed preprocessing strategies documenting 7 processing steps with technical parameters
Excellent funding and motivation transparency with complete grant information, creator attribution, and scientific objectives
Strong data composition documentation with 5 subpopulations, instance counts, and sampling methodology
Robust version tracking with 4 documented releases and clear update schedule through 2026
Extensive external resources section with 11 documented links to platforms, documentation, and publications
Well-documented use guidance with 5 intended uses and 4 discouraged uses covering ethical considerations
Comprehensive license terms with 12 specific provisions for registered access and data use
weaknesses: No explicit known_biases field to document systematic biases, though non-representative sampling is acknowledged
No explicit anomalies field to document data quality issues or outliers
No explicit related_datasets field with typed relationships to other datasets in the Bridge2AI program or broader ecosystem
While limitations are documented throughout, they are not consolidated in a dedicated known_limitations field for easy reference
recommendations: Add explicit known_biases section to document potential biases from non-representative sampling, specialty clinic recruitment, and cohort selection
Create anomalies section to document any data quality issues encountered during collection or processing
Add related_datasets field with typed relationships to other Bridge2AI datasets (AI-READI, CHORUS, CM4AI) and complementary voice datasets
Consolidate limitations into dedicated known_limitations field while retaining context-specific documentation
Consider adding explicit publisher field naming PhysioNet/MIT as primary publisher organization
overall_assessment: The VOICE D4D datasheet demonstrates exceptional quality and completeness, achieving 92% overall score (46/50 points). The datasheet excels in all foundational areas including discovery, access, ethics, technical transparency, and scientific motivation. The comprehensive documentation of preprocessing strategies (7 detailed steps), ethical safeguards (IRB, consent, privacy, vulnerable populations), and version tracking (4 releases with detailed change logs) sets a high standard for dataset documentation. The primary gaps are in explicit documentation of known biases, data anomalies, and typed dataset relationships - areas where information may exist but is not formalized in dedicated schema fields. The datasheet successfully demonstrates that voice datasets can meet rigorous ethical and technical documentation standards while maintaining accessibility for AI/ML research.
